TopicTitle: Kethane Pack 0.9.2 - New cinematic trailer! - 1.0 compatibility update

Articles.Content:

Maybe set deposit origion

Like make ice mineable only on the icecaps of duna?

Iam thinking about some fun with TAC lifesuppot...

Edited September 12, 2013 by Radiokopf

Thanks bigNose Figured as much... it was fun getting that stuff there anyhow but just a tad disappointing. I take it you still need the ramjet and air intake or at leaset one or the other.

All you need is the Kethane Engine. It has an intake of it's own built in.
^^thanks did not know these things.

So im up and running my kethane ship on duna but I get flame out at about 5k. Once the kintake is all gone engines stop until i crash. Why dont the engines make more kintake once I get lower into the atmosphere?
They are very picky, if your going to fast they wont reignite.

Hi there! I searched this thread but couldn't find an answer, so I'm wondering if anyone can help me with configuring the Kethane resource itself. Ideally I'd like many small deposits rather than the few large patches that show up on planets by default.

What are these?

MinRadius = 7.29
MaxRadius = 16.2

The amounts are self-explanatory:

MinQuantity = 10000
MaxQuantity = 500000

Does this determine the size of a patch?

MinVertices = 20
MaxVertices = 50

Related to the top two?

RadiusVariance = 0.45

This seems pretty self-explanatory:

DepositCount = 17

Obviously something to do with random generation, but how does it tie in to the number patches above?

NumberOfTries = 30
SeedModifier = 0

Thanks for any help!
API and Modules Documentation

API and Modules Documentation

Thanks, I was looking for it under Settings.

So im up and running my kethane ship on duna but I get flame out at about 5k. Once the kintake is all gone engines stop until i crash. Why dont the engines make more kintake once I get lower into the atmosphere?

I think duna has oxygen because my normal engines worked on it :/ (either that or I'm going crazy)

Duna atmosphere does NOT contain oxygen, jet engines do NOT function there!

The Kethane turbine engine can run with ANY atmosphere. It is very powerful but HATES speed, go too fast and they flame out.
Is it possible to add other resources to the converters? I've got Deuterium as an available resource to burn, but don't know if I can make Kethane convert into it.

here

MODULE

{

name = KethaneConverter

InputRates

{

Kethane = 2.25

ElectricCharge = 6

}

OutputRatios

{

LiquidFuel = 0.97

}

}

Add this module to whatever part you want. Its named after the Output Res.

Can someone answer this question maybe ?

Disregard this message, I found the answer to my problem.

Have a nice day!

Edited September 14, 2013 by Cashen
Cashen: In the settings file, change the line to Debug = True. This will enable the debug menu in game which will give you the option to refill the deposit.

Cashen: In the settings file, change the line to Debug = True. This will enable the debug menu in game which will give you the option to refill the deposit.

There is no 'debug' true/false line in my settings file. Do I have to add the whole thing?

I've made a plugin and for convenience I was going to release it as 2 versions, 1 linked against the Kethane assembly and one not (it tracks charge usage and without the ability to call Kethane PartModule subclasses no Kethane parts would be able to be checked by it). No Kethane objects or code is in my plugin and it requires that people have a Kethane installation to use the Kethane version (KSPs linker takes care of things at runtime). It's just a 'using Kethane' with a couple of method calls into the library.

I couldn't see anything specific in the license about calling the assembly so I thought I'd check in before I release.

I've made a plugin and for convenience I was going to release it as 2 versions, 1 linked against the Kethane assembly and one not (it tracks charge usage and without the ability to call Kethane PartModule subclasses no Kethane parts would be able to be checked by it). No Kethane objects or code is in my plugin and it requires that people have a Kethane installation to use the Kethane version (KSPs linker takes care of things at runtime). It's just a 'using Kethane' with a couple of method calls into the library.

Could you post (or PM) some details on what you've made and how it interfaces with Kethane? Use of the plugin as an assembly reference is governed by the license, but in all likelihood you'll be fine.

There is no 'debug' true/false line in my settings file. Do I have to add the whole thing?

Yes you need to add it if it isn't there
For some reason I'm getting malware warnings when I click the download link, any alternative links?

I get those too, using Avast.

Simply disable Avast for the duration of the download, it's a false positive.

I'm not sure what exactly triggers it, Avast only yells: "URL:Mal".

I love this mod, but what i really want are more kethane detectors in different sizes. The smaller one is super huge compared to some of my probes.. Is there like a parts pack with more converters/dectetors?
Would there happen to be an alternate download link? The current one seems to be down.

I want to make it to where when I kill a kerbal, it gives an outrageous amount of kethane, because, in all seriousness, it's a literal last resort that I would use. I've not lost a single Kerbal yet in over 50 flights this current save, I do not even plan on using this, but if it's possible to change this, I'll make it pretty freaking worth a dead kerbal.

I want to make it to where when I kill a kerbal, it gives an outrageous amount of kethane

The Kethane produced by the blender is already more than three times the mass of a Kerbal.
